ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The readings were hit or miss. Some really interesting, some I didn't care for at all.

Workload was heavy - 3 books through the semester plus multiple readings in other weeks but the readings were all really relevant and instructive. Just wish there was a way to reduce the volume for those of us who aren't fast readers (I do read fast, so it wasn't a problem for me, but even then it was a significant time commitment)
Excellent course. Highly recommend it. Professor is excellent!

This was a terrific, interesting, and inspiring course. I learned a great deal and it has made me more appreciative of environmental campaigns. I'd never considered working on a campaign before and now ... I will be disappointed if I don't work on a campaign when I graduate!
I can imagine that all of the evaluations for the class are very good. Other students recommeded the class to me, and I'm sure the popularity will continue next year after the rave reviews.

The speakers were, on the whole, fantastic. The last evening, at the Lawn Club, where we presented, was actually fantastic as well. I learned a lot and the campaigns chosen were quite instructive; folks did a great job of inserting lessons learned from the semester in their analysis of how the campaigns moved forward.
We heard real stories from practicer.
Guest lectures, assigned readings, discussions with other students, dinner...it was all pretty awesome.
The wide range of types of campaigns covered.Very interesting reading.Great guest lecturers.
I loved having real life campaigners come talk to us about their successes. This is a refreshing class mode. It's very inspiring too.
The variety of presenters.Food was much appreciated!
The best thing was hearing a new speaker each week talk about their campaign experiences.
It made me realize just how much I want advocacy to be a part of my future.
Excellent guest speakers. Very inspiring. Covers material that no other class at Yale addresses, but is very important to policy-making.
The incredible guest speakers and the ability to interview some of the most amazing leaders in the environmental activism community.
The quality of the guest speakers.

The best thing about this course was the guest speakers and the final paper. The guest speakers were fantastic and gave an incredible opportunity to hear the inside story behind many of the big campaigns for the past few decades. Hearing their insights was very valuable and revealed how campaigns work and how policy is made. The final paper was also a great opportunity to learn about a specific campaign and to talk to people who helped run the campaign. It's also a great chance to make connections with potential employers.
The readers were terrific but the speakers were absolutely inspiring. The work load was light, which was really nice.

It is turly a couse that alows the students to think, as opposed to some of our classes where we are expected to churn out grunt work. The speakers were all excellent. Michael is also a true gentlmen that treats the students as equals, without any superiority involved.

The guest speakers were the best part of this course. Almost all the speakers were great presenters and story tellers. Their case studies really highlighted the elements of campaigning we learned from the prof. and from the readings. The books/readings were great too.

This was a great course, where we approached issues differently from any of my other FES classes. Really a refreshing new perspective to look at how change is made, by real people in real campaigns. Michael knows so many wonderful people to bring in and they were all a pleasure to hear from and talk with.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: It was kind of annoying having to do reading commentaries every week, particularly on those weeks when I was least interested on a subject. Maybe give student 1-2 free passes, or just request X out of Y commentaries for the semester.
Need a bigger room that is conducive to conversation (not Burke).
Not applicable.
Would be great to have more discussion time to reflect on readings and speakers, perhaps every third or fourth lecture.

Given the time constraints of having so many amazing speakers, I know this is difficult, but I would love to hear more commentary on each of the campaigns from Professor Northrop. His insights are invaluable.

I can't really think of many, except that maybe there should be more campaign presentation days. The last few presentations were rushed and we couldn't ask questions, which was a shame. Loved the venue...
A small collaborative work group project as a complement the other aspects of the class might have been interesting.
The weekly written responses got tedious and felt like busy work some weeks (such as the week on Healthy Hospitals).

All the guests were very openly liberal. It would have been really great to stimulate discussion in a different direction, by inviting a corporate campaigner or someone who had to defend against an environmental campaign or someone who campaigns from a different perspective or in a different field (maybe not even environmentalism). Also, Michael is really bad about respecting time limits for the important presentations we all give at the end--he doesn't cut off the early people and asks them lots of questions, which results in the later people needing to shorten their presentations and not get any feedback. And it's a pity the class was so big.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Great
Very responsive to email
Prof. Northrop is great.
Both absolutely excellent.
Fantastic availability and quality of help from both the instructor and the TAs.
The instructor is incredibly helpful and responsive. He'll get back to your email within a day, if not sooner. It was a pleasure to be in the class.

Despite being an extremely busy professional, Professor Northrop always made himself available. He gave me incredible advice and personally connected me to individuals who will no doubt help to shape my future career.
Michael responded quickly to my emails.
Michael was incredibly helpful and available, as were the TAs.
TAs were always available and helpful.
Yes, I contacted the instructure and both TA's, and everyone was great.
Excellent. Quick to respond, quick to make time to meet.
Good!

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Helpful in understanding how environmental campaigns contribute to shaping the policy process.
Would like to perhaps work in campaigning in the future sometime, but I felt like I didn't have enough info on how to make things work - the course was great for that.

The course actually did not fit specifically into my overall program but I took it because it sounded interesting. Despite not being a perfect fit to my course of study, it was my favorite course this semester.
Very interested in passing environmental policy, and campaigning is a critical part of that process.
My interests lie at the intersection of human rights and environmental law and politics. This course fit perfectly into that area of study.
I wanted to learn more about campaigning and how to work with large corporations, as I am interested in corporate sustainability. This course offered a great introduction to how campaigns work.
As an Industrial Ecology major, it is not the typical class. I do feel that a knowledge of the subject and the tools involved are universal to nearly anyone.
Environmental campaigning is a good skill to have in any program/career.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: One of the more interesting offerings, I thought, among the courses I saw for the semester.
To understand environmental campaign and its influence on decision making

Dabbled (unsuccessfully) in environmental campaigning as an undergrad, haven't done anything since but have always been interested and followed ones that interest me. Wanted to learn more about professional campaigning.
I had heard good things from previous students
Wanted to 1) develop my understanding of policy making and 2) listen to speakers with real life success stories!
Interest, possible future practical use
Wanted to learn more about campaigns: never had been involved in one.
I took this course to learn about a field in which I knew very little.
After launching my own environmental campaign, I wanted to learn from the best to help ensure its success.
I learned to campaign by trial and error. I wanted to hear what the professionals have to say.

I wanted to learn how to work with and against corporations to make large change in business practices. I also wanted to learn more about environmental campaigns such as RAN/CITI, Home Depot and old growth forests, etc.
It was recommended by a friend so I sat in on the first few classes and I was just hooked. It was really a special class. Also the readers looked interesting.
I have gotten some exposure to NGOs through other classes such as the Environmental Protection Clinic, and wanted to go deeper into these types of issues.
To hear real-world case studies about campaigning.
I heard it was great, and not very hard--a neat way to think through issues at the end of my time at FES.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes! I thought q&a after each lecture demonstrated that people were really engaged; even when we went a few minutes over, the entire class usually stayed. This course engaged people consistently in a way a number of other courses I'm in don't. I would have liked time to debrief speakers, etc. however--perhaps for the first half-hour of each new class. We weren't able to discuss as a class our impressions of the campaigns/victories/etc. in a way that would have allowed us to analyze the work more deeply.
Yes
YES
Surpassed expectations
Yes
Yes and more so!
Exceeded my expectations.
Yes.
Yes, the speakers were excellent, and give an excellent picture of the inner-workings of successful campaigns.
Absolutely. From the incredible instruction, speakers, and case studies to the vibrant community and delicious weekly meals, this course was a must take.
Yes.
YES!
Yes, absolutely.
Yes, and it exceeded them.
Yes.
Yes, it was great!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Again, Yes!
Exceeded expectations
Yes
Yes
Yes. I got more out than I expected. I learned so much from the speakers and fellow classmates as they presented the campaign they researched. Michael is an excellent facilitator of conversation.
Yes.
Yes.I now have the tools to help gain meaningful results from my current and future campaigns.
Yes.
Yes, and more.
More.
I got more than I ever expected. The course was deeper than I ever imagined and went into topics and subjects that I never even know existed.
Yes.
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There were no work groups

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Great course. Pretty straight forward, so if the syllabus sounds like it is for you, it probably is!
take it, it's a fun course. It is also helpful in establishing networking contacts prior to the summer.
Do as many of the readings as possible, which means you'll have to start early!
Take this class. It is excellent. You won't regret it! Professor is excellent.
Stay up on the readings and get started on your paper early. Get contact info for the speakers that you're interested in, and get in touch with them.
Good class for a heavy focus on application-oriented teaching/lecturing.
Pick your paper topic early so that you can ensure ample time to interview a wide array of sources. Take advantage of Professors Northop's availability to help -- he is amazing!
Pace yourself with the readings.

I would strongly recommend this course to students interested in getting an inside look at how campaigns are run, how policy is actually shaped, and how to work with and against large corporations of all kinds. Michael is a fantastic teacher, the guest speakers are well-worth listening closely to, and the final paper is a great opportunity to speak with professionals involved with a campaign you're interested in. Overall, it's a great class with a fairly light workload but you'll gain a lot from it.
Do all the work, come to all the classes, and soak it all in.
Put a lot into the class and you'll get a lot out of it.
Spend the time to pick the right campaign to research for the term paper.
